content.text:
# High Banks cup and ring markings

| gbgridref = NX 70917 48960
| locmapin = Scotland Dumfries and Galloway
| coordinates =
| image = Cup and ring markings - geograph.org.uk - 793177.jpg
}}
The High Banks cup and ring markings are a series of Neolithic or Bronze Age carvings on an outcrop of rock near High Banks farm, 3 km SE of Kirkcudbright, Dumfries and Galloway. They are one of the best collections of cup and ring markings in Galloway.
References
External links
* [https://www.rockart.scot/rock-art-database/?scrapToolsaction=datatools:panel&id=8C0A6095-D054-4E3B-847EB7FF900D95873%7C Digital scan of the panel at Scotland's Rock Art Project]
